title: Disclosure of github access token in config file via nignx off-by-slash
content:
Summary:
██████████ is vulnerable to Nginx off-by-slash vulnerability that exposes Git configuration.
Steps To Reproduce:
Visit https://█████████████ to download git config containing username and token.
Use it to pull entire source code via git clone ████████
Leaked:
Code 304 Bytes
1[core]
2	repositoryformatversion = 0
3	filemode = true
4	bare = false
5	logallrefupdates = true
6[remote "origin"]
7	url = ████
8	fetch = +refs/heads/*:refs/remotes/origin/*
9[branch "master"]
10	remote = origin
11	merge = refs/heads/master
12[branch "vespa-2021-Q4"]
13	remote = origin
14	merge = refs/heads/vespa-2021-Q4
Impact
Malicious attacker can mess around using the leaked github token to access and modify or even try to delete github repos that the token has permission to.
steps: Visit https://█████████████ to download git config containing username and token.
Use it to pull entire source code via git clone ████████
vuln_description: ██████████ is vulnerable to Nginx off-by-slash vulnerability that exposes Git configuration, including a GitHub access token. This allows malicious actors to access and modify repositories that the token has permissions for.
reason: The vulnerability involves a straightforward exploitation of an Nginx misconfiguration (off-by-slash) leading to direct exposure of sensitive credentials. The attack path is linear and doesn't require complex interactions between components or manipulation of application states.
